tr.td: Courses and Course Proposals
View a course or browse the catalog?
Under Find Courses and Programs, select a link to locate a course or program. To browse the catalog, click Browse Course Catalog.
Propose a new course?
Under Proposals, select Propose a Course. This will start a new course proposal.
Modify a course?

Under Find Courses and Programs, click Find Courses locate the course you want to modify. Then use the dropdown 'Proposal Actions', just below the course title, and select 'Modify this Course'. This will start a modification proposal.
Check the status of my course proposal?

Under Proposals, click My Actionlist. Then go to the outbox section of your Action List, where you will see a list of documents. Find the document you wish to check, and open it to review the document log.
See what proposals are in review?
Under Proposals, you can search for proposals using the Find Course Proposals link
Approve (or reject) a course proposal?

Under Proposals, click My Actionlist. This will take you to your list of Kuali Student documents and processes requiring your attention. You can sort the list by document type, and then proceed through the list of course proposals. In order to approve or reject a proposal, select it from the list. It will open on the summary page, where you can review the proposal. Use the Workflow Actions dropdown to make a decision for the proposal.
Programs
View program details? (entrance or completion requirements)
Under Find Courses and Programs, click the Find Programs link to locate the program. To browse the catalog, click Browse Course Catalog.
Edit a program?
Under Find Courses and Programs, click Find Programs to locate the program. Then click the Edit link in the left navigation panel, which will activate an editable mode for the program.
Other Curriculum Tools
View a course set or build a new one?
Under Management Tools, click Course Set Management, where you will have the option to search for a course set or create a new one
Manage Learning Objectives? (coming soon)
Under Management Tools, click on the Learning Objectives, where you will have the option to search for a Learning Objective or create a new one.
Run analysis (examine prerequisite chains)? (coming soon)
Under Management Tools, click on the Run Analysis link, where you can enter the course you want to run analysis on.
